intro: Leycesteria crocothyrsos, commonly known as the golden thread, is a species of flowering plant in the family Caprifoliaceae. It is native to the eastern United States, particularly found in moist woodlands and stream banks. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in late spring to early summer. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with finely serrated edges. The plant produces small, red berries that are an important food source for birds and other wildlife.
